sn19.12:4.1: “Just now, Reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a man sunk in a sewer, eating dung with both hands. …” …
sn19.12:4.2: “That being used to be a nasty brahmin right here in Rājagaha.
sn19.12:4.3: In the time of the Buddha Kassapa’s dispensation he invited the Saṅgha of mendicants for a meal. He filled a trough with dung and said:
sn19.12:4.4: ‘My good men, eat as much as you like, and take what’s left.’ …”
